definitions: To turn up the earth of (a field or area of land) with a plough, especially before sowing.
To move in a fast, uncontrolled, or clumsy way.
To make (a way or path) with difficulty.
To work steadily and laboriously at a task or job.
examples: Farmers plough the fields in spring.
The car ploughed into the ditch.
He ploughed his way through the crowd.
